thread.title: Denver police sergeants to wear new body cameras, chief says
thread.title_full: Denver police sergeants to wear new body cameras, chief says - The Denver Post

author: Noelle Phillips
title: Denver police sergeants to wear new body cameras, chief says
text:
Denver Police C0hief Robert White said Tuesday he wants sergeants in the department to wear body cameras, a switch to what was proposed previously.
Speaking to the Denver City Council's safety committee, White said the department will issue the first 200 body cameras in November to officers in District 6 and the traffic and gang units. The other five districts will be equipped throughout 2016.
In the draft of the policy released in September , officers working off-duty and sergeants were not included (only patrol officers and corporals).
But after criticism, White said recently off-duty cops will be required to wear body cameras. Tuesday he told the safety committee it would be a challenge but doable.
Pressure has been growing for the police department to require the cameras for officers working off-duty security. When police work these assignments, their wages are paid by the businesses who hire them. But the officers wear their uniforms, use department-issued equipment and are bound by department rules. If they use excessive force, the city can be held liable.
